Create Bivariate Maps for Agricultural Diversity Analysis

Source: R/functions.R
diversity_mapping.Rd

Generate bivariate maps showing the relationship between crop diversity (unique crop count) and crop rotation transitions at district and river basin levels.

diversity_mapping(input, agg_cols, districts, EZGs = NA, AOIs = NA, BS = NULL)

Arguments

input

An sf object containing agricultural field data with crop information over multiple years

agg_cols

Character vector specifying the column names containing crop information for each year

districts

sf object containing district-level polygons with at least "District" and "geometry" columns

EZGs

Optional sf object containing river basin (EZG) polygons. Default NA

AOIs

Optional sf object containing areas of interest (AOI) polygons. Default NA

BS

A terra raster object for additional analysis. Default NULL

Value

List containing three elements:

  • District_div_data: Bivariate data for districts

  • EZG_div_data: Bivariate data for river basins (if EZGs provided)

  • AOI_div_data: Bivariate data for areas of interest (if AOIs provided)

Details

This function creates bivariate choropleth maps showing the relationship between two agricultural diversity metrics:

  1. Number of unique crops grown in each spatial unit

  2. Number of crop transitions (crop changes between consecutive years)

The metrics are calculated first at field level, then aggregated to district and river basin level using both simple means and area-weighted means. The resulting maps use a 3x3 bivariate color scheme to show the relationship between these metrics.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Create maps for districts only
maps <- diversity_mapping(
  input = crop_data,
  agg_cols = c("crop_2020", "crop_2021", "crop_2022"),
  districts = district_polygons
)

# Create maps for both districts and river basins
maps <- diversity_mapping(
  input = crop_data,
  agg_cols = c("Name_2020", "Name_2021", "Name_2022"),
  districts = district_polygons,
  EZGs = river_basin_polygons
)
} # }
